data.event: Several families settled near Otsego Lake around 1762, but little further development occurred until after the American Revolution.
In 1778, Joseph Brant, native leader, led an expedition that burned the town and took captives.

event.title: was formed from part of the Town of Cherry Valley in 1797

data.event: The Town of Springfield was formed from part of the Town of Cherry Valley in 1797.

George Hyde Clarke, grandson to the Acting Governor of New York from 1736-1743 (under British rule) [1] Arthur L. Ryerson, steel industrialist, who died on the Titantic maintained a summer home for his family in Springfield Center known as Ringwood Henry Lansing Wardwell, New York City financier, maintained a summer estate and farm in Springfield Center known as Pinehurst.
